channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Greetings from Palmyra, Syria, with its once-grand hotel named for a warrior queen
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international correspondents share snapshots of moments from their lives and work around the wor...

item.title: Inflation is holding steady as Trump's tariffs have yet to fully hit
item.description: Consumer prices in May were up 2.4% from a year ago, but inflation eased on a monthly basis, according to the latest figures from the Labor Department

item.title: Photos: See the dazzling pictures of June's Strawberry Moon
item.description: A strawberry moon occurs during the time of year when strawberries fully ripen.

item.title: The military's role in LA as protests persist. And, Trump appeals his criminal case

item.title: What we know about Austria school shooting
item.description: It is not yet known why a 21-year-old Austrian man committed a shooting that left 10 people dead.

item.title: Inflation rate edged higher by 2.4% in May, CPI report shows
item.description: The inflation rate is inching higher, with Wall Street expecting tariffs to increase prices throughout the remainder of 2025.

item.title: Bomb attack plans found at Austria gunman's home
item.description: Police say they also found a non-functional pipe bomb and a "farewell letter" during a search.

item.title: Who has been arrested by ICE under Trump?
item.description: Tens of thousands of people have been detained since Trump took office, including permanent residents.

item.title: Elon Musk says he regrets some posts about Donald Trump
item.description: The billionaire says his posts went "too far" after attacking the US president's planned tax and spending bill.

item.title: AP PHOTOS: Protests over immigration raids spread beyond Los Angeles

item.title: Inside the DOJ "rubber room," where veteran lawyers stream shows to pass time
item.description: Nearly a dozen of the government's most seasoned lawyers have been relegated to what they refer to as the Justice Dept. rubber room.
